intro: Euploca mendocina, commonly known as the Mendocino euploca, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or along streambanks. Euploca mendocina is often found in areas with high humidity and is considered a rare and endemic species.
